snippet: In Berlin, there is a deep consensus among policy makers and economists — bordering on orthodoxy — that austerity and growth are not enemies. They are comrades.
abstract: News analysis; deep consensus exists among German policy makers and economists that austerity and growth are not enemies, but comrades; Jens Weidmann, president of German central bank Bundesbank, has called on government to speed up efforts to cut new borrowing close to zero and balance the budget, setting an example for the rest of the beleaguered euro zone.
lead_paragraph: In Berlin, there is a deep consensus among policy makers and economists — bordering on orthodoxy — that austerity and growth are not enemies. They are comrades.

headline.main: Germany Resists Europe's Pleas to Spend More
headline.print_headline: Despite Europe’s Pleas, Germany Resists Spending
